detaileddescription.para: Maps a FLAC__Metadata_SimpleIteratorStatus to a C string.
Using a FLAC__Metadata_SimpleIteratorStatus as the index to this array will give the string equivalent. The contents should not be modified.
Maps a FLAC__Metadata_ChainStatus to a C string.
Using a FLAC__Metadata_ChainStatus as the index to this array will give the string equivalent. The contents should not be modified.

detaileddescription.para: Read the STREAMINFO metadata block of the given FLAC file. This function will try to skip any ID3v2 tag at the head of the file.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the FLAC file to read.

A pointer to space for the STREAMINFO block. Since FLAC__StreamMetadata is a simple structure with no memory allocation involved, you pass the address of an existing structure. It need not be initialized. filename!=NULL streaminfo!=NULL

true if a valid STREAMINFO block was read from filename. Returns false if there was a memory allocation error, a file decoder error, or the file contained no STREAMINFO block. (A memory allocation error is possible because this function must set up a file decoder.)

detaileddescription.para: Read the VORBIS_COMMENT metadata block of the given FLAC file. This function will try to skip any ID3v2 tag at the head of the file.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the FLAC file to read.
The address where the returned pointer will be stored. The tags object must be deleted by the caller using FLAC__metadata_object_delete(). filename!=NULL tags!=NULL

true if a valid VORBIS_COMMENT block was read from filename, and *tags will be set to the address of the metadata structure. Returns false if there was a memory allocation error, a file decoder error, or the file contained no VORBIS_COMMENT block, and *tags will be set to NULL.

detaileddescription.para: Read the CUESHEET metadata block of the given FLAC file. This function will try to skip any ID3v2 tag at the head of the file.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the FLAC file to read.
The address where the returned pointer will be stored. The cuesheet object must be deleted by the caller using FLAC__metadata_object_delete(). filename!=NULL cuesheet!=NULL

true if a valid CUESHEET block was read from filename, and *cuesheet will be set to the address of the metadata structure. Returns false if there was a memory allocation error, a file decoder error, or the file contained no CUESHEET block, and *cuesheet will be set to NULL.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *filename, FLAC__StreamMetadata **picture, FLAC__StreamMetadata_Picture_Type type, const char *mime_type, const FLAC__byte *description, unsigned max_width, unsigned max_height, unsigned max_depth, unsigned max_colors)
memberdef.name: FLAC__metadata_get_picture

detaileddescription.para: Read a PICTURE metadata block of the given FLAC file. This function will try to skip any ID3v2 tag at the head of the file. Since there can be more than one PICTURE block in a file, this function takes a number of parameters that act as constraints to the search. The PICTURE block with the largest area matching all the constraints will be returned, or *picture will be set to NULL if there was no such block.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the FLAC file to read.
The address where the returned pointer will be stored. The picture object must be deleted by the caller using FLAC__metadata_object_delete().
The desired picture type. Use -1 to mean "any type".
The desired MIME type, e.g. "image/jpeg". The string will be matched exactly. Use NULL to mean "any MIME type".
The desired description. The string will be matched exactly. Use NULL to mean "any description".
The maximum width in pixels desired. Use (unsigned)(-1) to mean "any width".
The maximum height in pixels desired. Use (unsigned)(-1) to mean "any height".
The maximum color depth in bits-per-pixel desired. Use (unsigned)(-1) to mean "any depth".
The maximum number of colors desired. Use (unsigned)(-1) to mean "any number of colors". filename!=NULL picture!=NULL

true if a valid PICTURE block was read from filename, and *picture will be set to the address of the metadata structure. Returns false if there was a memory allocation error, a file decoder error, or the file contained no PICTURE block, and *picture will be set to NULL.

detaileddescription.para: Create a new iterator instance.

parameterdescription.para: NULL if there was an error allocating memory, else the new instance.

detaileddescription.para: Free an iterator instance. Deletes the object pointed to by iterator.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing iterator. iterator!=NULL

detaileddescription.para: Get the current status of the iterator. Call this after a function returns false to get the reason for the error. Also resets the status to FLAC__METADATA_SIMPLE_ITERATOR_STATUS_OK.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing iterator. iterator!=NULL
The current status of the iterator.

memberdef.argsstring: (FLAC__Metadata_SimpleIterator *iterator, const char *filename, FLAC__bool read_only, FLAC__bool preserve_file_stats)
memberdef.name: FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init

detaileddescription.para: Initialize the iterator to point to the first metadata block in the given FLAC file.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing iterator.
The path to the FLAC file.
If true, the FLAC file will be opened in read-only mode; if false, the FLAC file will be opened for edit even if no edits are performed.
If true, the owner and modification time will be preserved even if the FLAC file is written to. iterator!=NULL filename!=NULL
false if a memory allocation error occurs, the file can't be opened, or another error occurs, else true.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the FLAC file is writable. If false, calls to FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_set_block() and FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_insert_block_after() will fail.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing iterator. iterator!=NULL
See above.

detaileddescription.para: Moves the iterator forward one metadata block, returning false if already at the end.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init()
false if already at the last metadata block of the chain, else true.

detaileddescription.para: Moves the iterator backward one metadata block, returning false if already at the beginning.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init()
false if already at the first metadata block of the chain, else true.

detaileddescription.para: Returns a flag telling if the current metadata block is the last.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init()
true if the current metadata block is the last in the file, else false.

detaileddescription.para: Get the offset of the metadata block at the current position. This avoids reading the actual block data which can save time for large blocks.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init()
The offset of the metadata block at the current iterator position. This is the byte offset relative to the beginning of the file of the current metadata block's header.

detaileddescription.para: Get the type of the metadata block at the current position. This avoids reading the actual block data which can save time for large blocks.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init()
The type of the metadata block at the current iterator position.

detaileddescription.para: Get the length of the metadata block at the current position. This avoids reading the actual block data which can save time for large blocks.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init()
The length of the metadata block at the current iterator position. The is same length as that in the metadata block header, i.e. the length of the metadata body that follows the header.

detaileddescription.para: Get the application ID of the APPLICATION block at the current position. This avoids reading the actual block data which can save time for large blocks.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator.
A pointer to a buffer of at least 4 bytes where the ID will be stored. iterator!=NULL id!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init()

true if the ID was successfully read, else false, in which case you should check FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_status() to find out why. If the status is FLAC__METADATA_SIMPLE_ITERATOR_STATUS_ILLEGAL_INPUT, then the current metadata block is not an APPLICATION block. Otherwise if the status is FLAC__METADATA_SIMPLE_ITERATOR_STATUS_READ_ERROR or FLAC__METADATA_SIMPLE_ITERATOR_STATUS_SEEK_ERROR, an I/O error occurred and the iterator can no longer be used.

detaileddescription.para: Get the metadata block at the current position. You can modify the block but must use FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_set_block() to write it back to the FLAC file.
You must call FLAC__metadata_object_delete() on the returned object when you are finished with it.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init()
The current metadata block, or NULL if there was a memory allocation error.

detaileddescription.para: Write a block back to the FLAC file. This function tries to be as efficient as possible; how the block is actually written is shown by the following:
Existing block is a STREAMINFO block and the new block is a STREAMINFO block: the new block is written in place. Make sure you know what you're doing when changing the values of a STREAMINFO block.
Existing block is a STREAMINFO block and the new block is a not a STREAMINFO block: this is an error since the first block must be a STREAMINFO block. Returns false without altering the file.
Existing block is not a STREAMINFO block and the new block is a STREAMINFO block: this is an error since there may be only one STREAMINFO block. Returns false without altering the file.
Existing block and new block are the same length: the existing block will be replaced by the new block, written in place.

Existing block is longer than new block: if use_padding is true, the existing block will be overwritten in place with the new block followed by a PADDING block, if possible, to make the total size the same as the existing block. Remember that a padding block requires at least four bytes so if the difference in size between the new block and existing block is less than that, the entire file will have to be rewritten, using the new block's exact size. If use_padding is false, the entire file will be rewritten, replacing the existing block by the new block.

Existing block is shorter than new block: if use_padding is true, the function will try and expand the new block into the following PADDING block, if it exists and doing so won't shrink the PADDING block to less than 4 bytes. If there is no following PADDING block, or it will shrink to less than 4 bytes, or use_padding is false, the entire file is rewritten, replacing the existing block with the new block. Note that in this case any following PADDING block is preserved as is.
After writing the block, the iterator will remain in the same place, i.e. pointing to the new block.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator.
The block to set.
See above. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init() block!=NULL
true if successful, else false.

detaileddescription.para: This is similar to FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_set_block() except that instead of writing over an existing block, it appends a block after the existing block. use_padding is again used to tell the function to try an expand into following padding in an attempt to avoid rewriting the entire file.
This function will fail and return false if given a STREAMINFO block.
After writing the block, the iterator will be pointing to the new block.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator.
The block to set.
See above. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init() block!=NULL
true if successful, else false.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes the block at the current position. This will cause the entire FLAC file to be rewritten, unless use_padding is true, in which case the block will be replaced by an equal-sized PADDING block. The iterator will be left pointing to the block before the one just deleted.
You may not delete the STREAMINFO block.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator.
See above. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_init()
true if successful, else false.

detaileddescription.para: Create a new chain instance.

parameterdescription.para: NULL if there was an error allocating memory, else the new instance.

detaileddescription.para: Free a chain instance. Deletes the object pointed to by chain.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing chain. chain!=NULL

The current status of the chain.

The path to the FLAC file to read. chain!=NULL filename!=NULL
true if a valid list of metadata blocks was read from filename, else false. On failure, check the status with FLAC__metadata_chain_status().

true if a valid list of metadata blocks was read from filename, else false. On failure, check the status with FLAC__metadata_chain_status().

memberdef.argsstring: (FLAC__Metadata_Chain *chain, FLAC__IOHandle handle, FLAC__IOCallbacks callbacks, FLAC__bool is_ogg)
memberdef.name: chain_read_with_callbacks_

detaileddescription.para: Read all metadata from a FLAC stream into the chain via I/O callbacks.
The handle need only be open for reading, but must be seekable. The equivalent minimum stdio fopen() file mode is "r" (or "rb" for Windows).

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing chain.
The I/O handle of the FLAC stream to read. The handle will NOT be closed after the metadata is read; that is the duty of the caller.
A set of callbacks to use for I/O. The mandatory callbacks are read, seek, and tell. chain!=NULL
true if a valid list of metadata blocks was read from handle, else false. On failure, check the status with FLAC__metadata_chain_status().

detaileddescription.para: Read all metadata from an Ogg FLAC stream into the chain via I/O callbacks.
The handle need only be open for reading, but must be seekable. The equivalent minimum stdio fopen() file mode is "r" (or "rb" for Windows).

simplesect.para: Ogg FLAC metadata data writing is not supported yet and FLAC__metadata_chain_write() will fail.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing chain.
The I/O handle of the Ogg FLAC stream to read. The handle will NOT be closed after the metadata is read; that is the duty of the caller.
A set of callbacks to use for I/O. The mandatory callbacks are read, seek, and tell. chain!=NULL
true if a valid list of metadata blocks was read from handle, else false. On failure, check the status with FLAC__metadata_chain_status().

detaileddescription.para: Checks if writing the given chain would require the use of a temporary file, or if it could be written in place.

Under certain conditions, padding can be utilized so that writing edited metadata back to the FLAC file does not require rewriting the entire file. If rewriting is required, then a temporary workfile is required. When writing metadata using callbacks, you must check this function to know whether to call FLAC__metadata_chain_write_with_callbacks() or FLAC__metadata_chain_write_with_callbacks_and_tempfile(). When writing with FLAC__metadata_chain_write(), the temporary file is handled internally.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing chain.

Whether or not padding will be allowed to be used during the write. The value of use_padding given here must match the value later passed to FLAC__metadata_chain_write_with_callbacks() or FLAC__metadata_chain_write_with_callbacks_with_tempfile(). chain!=NULL
true if writing the current chain would require a tempfile, or false if metadata can be written in place.

detaileddescription.para: Write all metadata out to the FLAC file. This function tries to be as efficient as possible; how the metadata is actually written is shown by the following:
If the current chain is the same size as the existing metadata, the new data is written in place.

If the current chain is longer than the existing metadata, and use_padding is true, and the last block is a PADDING block of sufficient length, the function will truncate the final padding block so that the overall size of the metadata is the same as the existing metadata, and then just rewrite the metadata. Otherwise, if not all of the above conditions are met, the entire FLAC file must be rewritten. If you want to use padding this way it is a good idea to call FLAC__metadata_chain_sort_padding() first so that you have the maximum amount of padding to work with, unless you need to preserve ordering of the PADDING blocks for some reason.

If the current chain is shorter than the existing metadata, and use_padding is true, and the final block is a PADDING block, the padding is extended to make the overall size the same as the existing data. If use_padding is true and the last block is not a PADDING block, a new PADDING block is added to the end of the new data to make it the same size as the existing data (if possible, see the note to FLAC__metadata_simple_iterator_set_block() about the four byte limit) and the new data is written in place. If none of the above apply or use_padding is false, the entire FLAC file is rewritten.
If preserve_file_stats is true, the owner and modification time will be preserved even if the FLAC file is written.

For this write function to be used, the chain must have been read with FLAC__metadata_chain_read()/FLAC__metadata_chain_read_ogg(), not FLAC__metadata_chain_read_with_callbacks()/FLAC__metadata_chain_read_ogg_with_callbacks().

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing chain.
See above.
See above. chain!=NULL
true if the write succeeded, else false. On failure, check the status with FLAC__metadata_chain_status().

memberdef.argsstring: (FLAC__Metadata_Chain *chain, FLAC__bool use_padding, FLAC__IOHandle handle, FLAC__IOCallbacks callbacks)
memberdef.name: FLAC__metadata_chain_write_with_callbacks

detaileddescription.para: Write all metadata out to a FLAC stream via callbacks.
(See FLAC__metadata_chain_write() for the details on how padding is used to write metadata in place if possible.)
The handle must be open for updating and be seekable. The equivalent minimum stdio fopen() file mode is "r+" (or "r+b" for Windows).

For this write function to be used, the chain must have been read with FLAC__metadata_chain_read_with_callbacks()/FLAC__metadata_chain_read_ogg_with_callbacks(), not FLAC__metadata_chain_read()/FLAC__metadata_chain_read_ogg(). Also, FLAC__metadata_chain_check_if_tempfile_needed() must have returned false.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing chain.
See FLAC__metadata_chain_write()
The I/O handle of the FLAC stream to write. The handle will NOT be closed after the metadata is written; that is the duty of the caller.
A set of callbacks to use for I/O. The mandatory callbacks are write and seek. chain!=NULL
true if the write succeeded, else false. On failure, check the status with FLAC__metadata_chain_status().

memberdef.argsstring: (FLAC__Metadata_Chain *chain, FLAC__bool use_padding, FLAC__IOHandle handle, FLAC__IOCallbacks callbacks, FLAC__IOHandle temp_handle, FLAC__IOCallbacks temp_callbacks)
memberdef.name: FLAC__metadata_chain_write_with_callbacks_and_tempfile

detaileddescription.para: Write all metadata out to a FLAC stream via callbacks.
(See FLAC__metadata_chain_write() for the details on how padding is used to write metadata in place if possible.)

This version of the write-with-callbacks function must be used when FLAC__metadata_chain_check_if_tempfile_needed() returns true. In this function, you must supply an I/O handle corresponding to the FLAC file to edit, and a temporary handle to which the new FLAC file will be written. It is the caller's job to move this temporary FLAC file on top of the original FLAC file to complete the metadata edit.
The handle must be open for reading and be seekable. The equivalent minimum stdio fopen() file mode is "r" (or "rb" for Windows).

The temp_handle must be open for writing. The equivalent minimum stdio fopen() file mode is "w" (or "wb" for Windows). It should be an empty stream, or at least positioned at the start-of-file (in which case it is the caller's duty to truncate it on return).

For this write function to be used, the chain must have been read with FLAC__metadata_chain_read_with_callbacks()/FLAC__metadata_chain_read_ogg_with_callbacks(), not FLAC__metadata_chain_read()/FLAC__metadata_chain_read_ogg(). Also, FLAC__metadata_chain_check_if_tempfile_needed() must have returned true.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing chain.
See FLAC__metadata_chain_write()
The I/O handle of the original FLAC stream to read. The handle will NOT be closed after the metadata is written; that is the duty of the caller.
A set of callbacks to use for I/O on handle. The mandatory callbacks are read, seek, and eof.
The I/O handle of the FLAC stream to write. The handle will NOT be closed after the metadata is written; that is the duty of the caller.
A set of callbacks to use for I/O on temp_handle. The only mandatory callback is write. chain!=NULL
true if the write succeeded, else false. On failure, check the status with FLAC__metadata_chain_status().

detaileddescription.para: Merge adjacent PADDING blocks into a single block.

simplesect.para: This function does not write to the FLAC file, it only modifies the chain.
Any iterator on the current chain will become invalid after this call. You should delete the iterator and get a new one.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing chain. chain!=NULL

detaileddescription.para: This function will move all PADDING blocks to the end on the metadata, then merge them into a single block.

simplesect.para: This function does not write to the FLAC file, it only modifies the chain.
Any iterator on the current chain will become invalid after this call. You should delete the iterator and get a new one.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing chain. chain!=NULL

detaileddescription.para: Create a new iterator instance.

parameterdescription.para: NULL if there was an error allocating memory, else the new instance.

detaileddescription.para: Free an iterator instance. Deletes the object pointed to by iterator.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing iterator. iterator!=NULL

detaileddescription.para: Initialize the iterator to point to the first metadata block in the given chain.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing iterator.
A pointer to an existing and initialized (read) chain. iterator!=NULL chain!=NULL

detaileddescription.para: Moves the iterator forward one metadata block, returning false if already at the end.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_iterator_init()
false if already at the last metadata block of the chain, else true.

detaileddescription.para: Moves the iterator backward one metadata block, returning false if already at the beginning.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_iterator_init()
false if already at the first metadata block of the chain, else true.

detaileddescription.para: Get the type of the metadata block at the current position.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_iterator_init()
The type of the metadata block at the current iterator position.

detaileddescription.para: Get the metadata block at the current position. You can modify the block in place but must write the chain before the changes are reflected to the FLAC file. You do not need to call FLAC__metadata_iterator_set_block() to reflect the changes; the pointer returned by FLAC__metadata_iterator_get_block() points directly into the chain.

simplesect.para: Do not call FLAC__metadata_object_delete() on the returned object; to delete a block use FLAC__metadata_iterator_delete_block().

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_iterator_init()
The current metadata block.

detaileddescription.para: Set the metadata block at the current position, replacing the existing block. The new block passed in becomes owned by the chain and it will be deleted when the chain is deleted.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator.
A pointer to a metadata block. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_iterator_init() block!=NULL
false if the conditions in the above description are not met, or a memory allocation error occurs, otherwise true.

detaileddescription.para: Removes the current block from the chain. If replace_with_padding is true, the block will instead be replaced with a padding block of equal size. You can not delete the STREAMINFO block. The iterator will be left pointing to the block before the one just "deleted", even if replace_with_padding is true.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator.
See above. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_iterator_init()
false if the conditions in the above description are not met, otherwise true.

detaileddescription.para: Insert a new block before the current block. You cannot insert a block before the first STREAMINFO block. You cannot insert a STREAMINFO block as there can be only one, the one that already exists at the head when you read in a chain. The chain takes ownership of the new block and it will be deleted when the chain is deleted. The iterator will be left pointing to the new block.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an existing initialized iterator.
A pointer to a metadata block to insert. iterator!=NULL iterator has been successfully initialized with FLAC__metadata_iterator_init()
false if the conditions in the above description are not met, or a memory allocation error occurs, otherwise true.

detaileddescription.para: Insert a new block after the current block. You cannot insert a STREAMINFO block as there can be only one, the one that already exists at the head when you read in a chain. The chain takes ownership of the new block and it will be deleted when the chain is deleted. The iterator will be left pointing to the new block.
